definition: classifier for an activity, taken in its entirety (tirade of abuse, stint of music playing, bout of drinking etc)
to go through/to know well/(suffix) expert/to connect/to communicate/open/to clear/classifier for letters, telegrams, phone calls etc
classifier for a ream of paper
to order/to command/an order/warrant/writ/to cause/to make sth happen/virtuous/honorific title/season/government position (old)

sentences.english: Pour countries accepted the arrest warrant, told officers and soldiers themselves know the whereabouts of the person.
sentences.chinese: 傾國接下了通緝令，告訴官兵自己知道那人的下落。

sentences.english: Ben, fly her picture. Let's get a bolo broadcast out on her.
sentences.chinese: 本，把她的照片發出去，發佈通緝令。

sentences.english: Will there be wanted posters of you on the walls?
sentences.chinese: 那兒的牆上會貼上你的通緝令嗎？

sentences.english: The other really strange one is that there's a kind of a wanted poster for Lennon.
sentences.chinese: 另一個很奇怪的東西是，當時有一份列儂的通緝令。

pinyin: Guo2 ji4 Xing2 jing3 Zu3 zhi1

definition: Edward Snowden (1983-), American surveillance program whistleblower
The Sun (the name of various newspapers, notably in the UK and in Hong Kong)
on trial (for a crime)/to stand trial
(of a bird, fish etc) to be caught in a net/(of a tennis ball) to hit the net/(of a criminal) to be captured
